abstract: Pressing federal policy makers risks the appearance of recycling public money to advance a private agenda.
snippet: Pressing federal policy makers risks the appearance of recycling public money to advance a private agenda.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The financial giant Bank of America says it is no longer lobbying the federal government about its unfolding bank bailout. After receiving $45 billion in bailout money, lobbying was just too unseemly.

headline.main: Firms That Got Bailout Money Keep Lobbying
headline.print_headline: Firms That Got Bailout Money Keep Lobbying

byline.original: By David D. Kirkpatrick and Charlie Savage
